title: America’s ‘Renaissance’ to Gains for Renewables: Global Energy Trends
summary: In its annual report, the International Energy Agency said the global energy market — normally a slow-moving industry — was going through a major upheaval.

title: Venezuelan Debt Now Has the Vultures Circling
summary: With bond prices declining, investors attracted to distressed debt see a potential payday in the troubled country’s lucrative assets.

title: Angolan Leader Ousts Predecessor’s Daughter as Oil Chief
summary: The move shakes up the country’s political calculus and its economy, which has been plagued by corruption.

title: Norway’s Wealth Fund Considers Divesting From Oil Shares
summary: The move signals that the country, Europe’s top producer, does not have full confidence in oil’s future.

title: A Decision on the Keystone XL Pipeline and Black Friday Sales
summary: A ruling in Nebraska could resuscitate a pipeline linking Canada and the Gulf Coast. The Fed releases minutes of its last meeting. And Black Friday is coming.

title: Patent ‘Trolls’ Recede as Threat to Innovation. Will Justices Change That?
summary: Created to keep invalid claims from hurting companies, consumers and the economy, a government panel faces an existential threat in a case before the Supreme Court.

title: Russia Is Returning to Growth. (Just in Time for an Election.)
summary: Russia’s economy is finally emerging from a difficult recession, just as President Vladimir V. Putin gears up for a presidential election.

title: Housing Reports, a Possible Tax Vote and a Fed Chair Hearing
summary: Jerome Powell heads to Capitol Hill for hearings on his nomination to be the new Fed chief, while Janet Yellen’s appearance before Congress may be her last.

title: OPEC Leader Cites ‘New Optimism’ With Oil Prices on the Rise
summary: With a 20 percent price surge in less than three months, members of the oil cartel must decide whether to extend production cuts.

title: Shell, to Cut Carbon Output, Will Be Less of an Oil Company
summary: Under shareholder pressure, the European giant said it would halve its greenhouse-gas emissions by 2050 and increase investment in alternative fuels.

title: Saudi Arabia Drives OPEC to Extend Oil Production Cuts
summary: Saudi Arabia, the world’s largest oil producer and the cartel’s de facto leader, had insisted that extending the cuts was necessary.

title: Tax Bill Offers Last-Minute Breaks for Developers, Banks and Oil Industry
summary: In Senate Republicans’ mad dash to rewrite the tax code, lawmakers added loopholes for the wealthy and tightened deductions for middle-income workers.

title: China Will Lead an Electric Car Future, Ford’s Chairman Says
summary: Ford Motor said Tuesday that it planned to offer 15 new models in China by 2025 that run at least in part on batteries.

title: G.E. Cuts Jobs as It Navigates a Shifting Energy Market
summary: General Electric is cutting 18 percent of the jobs in its power division as it tries to keep pace with seismic shifts in the global energy market.

title: The Upstart Saudi Prince Who’s Throwing Caution to the Winds
summary: Prince Mohammed bin Salman is taking on all comers — the royal family, wealthy Saudis, Iran and Hezbollah. But is he ambitious or simply reckless?

title: In Rio de Janeiro, ‘Complete Vulnerability’ as Violence Surges
summary: After a respite that began before the Olympics, Brazil’s showcase city is reeling as ever more neighborhoods fall under the control of drug gangs.

title: Wake Up and Smell the Traffic? London Tries Coffee to Power Buses
summary: In an effort to curb toxic diesel fumes, oil from used grounds has been added to the fuel for the British capital’s iconic red double-deckers.

title: Can a Wild Daisy Rejuvenate Croatia’s Farming Economy?
summary: Cosmetics manufacturers use an extract from a proliferating plant on the Adriatic coast in high-end creams. But so far local farmers have been unable to benefit financially.

title: Reza Zarrab, Turk at Center of Iran Sanctions Case, Is Helping Prosecution
summary: The gold trader, arrested in 2016, pleaded guilty in a case that has strained relations between the United States and Turkey.

title: As Kenyatta is Inaugurated, Kenyans Are Feeling Economic Pain
summary: Kenya’s protracted presidential election badly hit the economy, affecting people across the social spectrum.

title: Venezuela Arrests 2 Former Oil Officials, Claiming Corruption
summary: Prosecutors said the arrests were part of a campaign against corruption, but critics of the president say he is engaged in a political purge.

title: Putin Confirms He Is Running for President
summary: In a choreographed announcement in a factory setting, he said he would stand for a fourth term as president in March. He is expected to win handily.

title: Mystery Buyer of $450 Million ‘Salvator Mundi’ Was a Saudi Prince
summary: The prince bought Leonardo da Vinci’s portrait of Christ, according to documents reviewed by The New York Times.

title: Senegal Opens Airport in Bid to Jump-Start Economy
summary: The nation and its president have high hopes that the $575 million airport will help it become a regional powerhouse.
